results.title: Distribution of the molecular absorption in front of the quasar B0218+357

main_text_sample.first_500: Molecular absorption at intermediate redshifts has been detected only in a few objects ( ). Among these, three absorption systems are caused by a galaxy lying on the line-of-sight of a quasar and acting as a gravitational lens. Two systems, one in front of PKS1830[MATH: -]211 (at [MATH: z=0.89]), the other in front of B0218+357 (at [MATH: z=0.68]) are detected at millimeter wavelengths in the lines of several molecules, including HCO[MATH: ^+], HCN and H[MATH: _2]CO.
